comments.body: When this was `any` it wasn't actually doing any type checking when you used `<Autosuggest />`
I'd make these `undefined` as well, unless you're sure they'll actually be `null`'s
These are indeed initialized as `null` in the codebase. See https://github.com/moroshko/react-autosuggest/blob/d626cef720df0ed5a4c7df4d539836b86bda6afa/src/Autosuggest.js#L101-L108

I thought about making this a conditional type:

```ts
type AutosuggestProps<TSuggestion, TSection> = [TSection] extends [never]
  ? AutosuggestPropsSingleSection<TSuggestion>
  : AutosuggestPropsMultiSection<TSuggestion, TSection>;
```

This would preserve outside usage of this type. However, this needs to be a union for the component's props type.
